laws_and_regulations.name: International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR)
laws_and_regulations.description: ITAR controls the export and import of defense-related articles and services on the United States Munitions List (USML).
laws_and_regulations.application: This regulation applies to the scenario as it governs the export of electronic components that may have military applications. Compliance ensures that the company does not inadvertently violate export control laws.

laws_and_regulations.name: Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS)
laws_and_regulations.description: RoHS restricts the use of specific hazardous materials found in electrical and electronic products.
laws_and_regulations.application: This regulation is relevant to the scenario as it ensures that the electronic components purchased do not contain hazardous substances, thereby complying with environmental standards.

laws_and_regulations.name: Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act (CPSIA)
laws_and_regulations.description: CPSIA sets safety standards and regulations for consumer products, including electronic devices.
laws_and_regulations.application: This law applies to the scenario by ensuring that the electronic components meet safety standards to protect consumers from potential hazards.

compliance_checklist.item: Verify that the supplier complies with ITAR regulations for any components with potential military applications.
Ensure that all electronic components meet RoHS standards by checking for certification or testing reports.
Confirm that the electronic components adhere to CPSIA safety standards by reviewing product safety documentation.
